channel.title: Essays on Robert J. Moore
channel.description: Recent content in Essays on Robert J. Moore

item.title: Radical Love
item.description: In the hot summer, I do reflect on topics that otherwise would not reach the mind of even the most critical of thinkers. Though, please do save the ones who think deeply about the most base of building blocks: cornerstones aren’t to be discarded lest the entire upwards efforts come falling down. This essay will explore Maslow’s pyramid. However, I do seek to unsettle Maslow’s pyramid–perhaps, even to overthrow the common sense apprasial of human needs and instead to show how I view the world.

item.title: AIMD
item.description:
Introduction

Artificial Intelligence (AI) is rapidly over-taking organic cognitive power.1 The online, and physical landscape has been everchanging since the popularization of Large Language Models (LLMs). AI can be seen as a logorithm of yes–no, or true–false, statements that sequentially result in some output. This is a gross simplification of the true math involved in constructing A.I. to its known performance.2 LLMs are, as in the name: large. The language model side of the LLM operates on the language(s) we use: common parlance, or technical language. Of course, medicine (MD, or PhD) is a broad scope of practice that encompases the known, and unknown, human body affects.
